ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Offline text and image translation on Android devices.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Complete offline translation using on-device models â€¢ Automatic language detection â€¢ Transliteration for non-latin scripts â€¢ Built-in word dictionary â€¢ Image translation
ðŸ“– Summary: The firefox-translator repository hosts an Android translator app that leverages Firefox Translation Models for on-device, offline translation. It supports text and image translation, automatic language detection, transliteration for non-latin scripts, and includes a built-in word dictionary.

ðŸš€ ghostscan | Rust
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Linux incident response and rootkit detection.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Hidden LKM detection â€¢ Kernel taint analysis â€¢ Ftrace redirection detection â€¢ Syscall table integrity verification â€¢ BPF object and program analysis
ðŸ“– Summary: ghostscan is a Rust-based Linux security scanner designed for incident response. It performs a fast, one-shot sweep to detect hidden rootkits, eBPF tricks, and ghost processes by analyzing various system aspects like the kernel, procfs, bpffs, and systemd.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ every-pdf | HTML
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Desktop PDF editing, conversion, merging, and security.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ PDF Editor â€¢ Convert PDF â€¢ Split Pages â€¢ Merge Files â€¢ Watermark
ðŸ“– Summary: The 'every-pdf' repository provides a cross-platform desktop application for PDF editing, conversion, merging, and security. It's built using Electron, Next.js, and Python, offering a comprehensive toolkit for managing PDF documents.

âœ¨ Mate-Engine | ShaderLab
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Creating and customizing desktop companions (avatars) with VRM support and modding capabilities.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Open Source â€¢ Mod Support â€¢ Custom VRM Support â€¢ Custom Shaders â€¢ .ME File Format
ðŸ“– Summary: Mate Engine is a free, open-source, and moddable alternative to Desktop Mate, designed to provide users with more freedom and fewer limitations. It supports custom VRM avatars, custom shaders, and offers a variety of features not found in Desktop Mate, such as animation modding and built-in SDK.

ðŸŒŸ TubeSummary | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Quickly summarizing YouTube videos and extracting key insights using AI.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Summarize YouTube videos instantly â€¢ AI-powered follow-up Q&A â€¢ Support for multiple LLM providers (OpenAI-compatible) â€¢ Customizable prompts and provider credentials â€¢ Works on Firefox and Chrome
ðŸ“– Summary: TubeSummary is a browser extension that uses AI to generate summaries of YouTube videos. It allows users to quickly extract key insights and ask follow-up questions about the content, enhancing learning and productivity. The extension supports multiple LLM providers and offers customizable prompts and credentials.
